snippet: The government confirmed that the office of Prime Minister Stephen Harper slowed the handling of refugee claims from Syrians in what his office described as a security audit.
abstract: Canadian government officials confirm media reports that Prime Minister Stephen Harper and his Conservative Party admit having stalled processing of refugee claims from Syrians by intervening in review process; political opponents seize on misstep by conservative government, which blames delays on logistical challenges and necessary security concerns.
lead_paragraph: The government confirmed that the office of Prime Minister Stephen Harper slowed the handling of refugee claims from Syrians in what his office described as a security audit.

headline.main: Syrian Asylum Claims in Canada Slowed by Stephen Harper’s Office
headline.print_headline: Canadian Leader’s Office Slowed Syrians’ Claims

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
